did.abstract: This is a collection of printed materials and photographs collected by Mary Hunt in preparation for writing Hunts' Guides, a series of Michigan travel books.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: The collection was donated by Mary Hunt (donor no. 8815) in 2003. Periodic additions have been received.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

userestrict.p: Copyright is retained by the original publishers of materials.

prefercite.p: item, folder title, box no., Mary Hunt Papers, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: A native of Michigan, Mary Hunt was co-founder and co-owner of the Ann Arbor Observer magazine with her husband Don Hunt from July 1976 to 1986. She was also the co-author of Hunts' Guides, a series of Michigan travel books.

scopecontent.p: This collection contains printed materials and photographs collected by Mary Hunt in preparation for writing the Hunts' Guides series of Michigan travel books. The collection is divided into two series:Printed Materials and Photographs.

The Printed Materials series consists of visitors' guides, restaurant menus, local maps and brochures about travel attractions, hotels and lodgings, local business and shopping destinations, as well as Hunt's notes on the cities. The files include statewide materials followed by regional, county, and local community. The bulk of this series relates to events and attractions in specific cities.

did.unittitle: Ottawa and Nicolet National Forest circa 1994
Other published materials, including some topical subdivisions, dated to 2009

scopecontent.p: The Photographs series consists of photographs, postcards, slides and negatives, arranged alphabetically by city name. Photos that have some information but not enough to identify cities are separately arranged in the Michigan Miscellaneous.

did.unittitle: Mainly 1991-1997 with some earlier dated images, 1991-1997

odd.p: (The descriptions were made by Mary Hunt)
